intro: Calawaya insolita, commonly known as the rare Hawaiian fern, is a unique plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Davalliaceae and is characterized by its delicate, frond-like structures that resemble ferns. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in rocky crevices or along stream banks. Calawaya insolita is known for its slow growth and is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and invasive species. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this botanical treasure.
